title: Wilson's Tales of the Borders and of Scotland, Volume 07
author: Various
snippet: One of the chief men amongst the gipsies on the Borders, at thebeginning of the last century, was Lussha Fleckie, who was only inferiorin authority among the tribes to King Faa, who dwelt at Kirk Yetholm,and boasted of reigning lord over a _free_ people.

title: Wilson's Tales of the Borders and of Scotland, Volume 07
author: Various
snippet: At Kirk Yetholm, however--which is their seat of royalty on theBorders, and where they have a lease of the houses in what is calledTinkler Row, for nineteen times nineteen years, on payment of a quitrent--they have not been so neglectful of the education of theirchildren as in other parts of the country.

title: Wilson's Tales of the Borders and of Scotland, Volume 07
author: Various
snippet: Theirchief places of resort, and where, during the inclemency of winter, theyhorded or housed together, were, Kirk Yetholm, Rothbury, Horncliff,Spittal, and Tweedmouth.

title: Guy Mannering, Or, the Astrologer - Complete
author: Scott, Walter
snippet: The individual gipsy upon whom the character of Meg Merrilies wasfounded was well known about the middle of the last century by thename of Jean Gordon, an inhabitant of the village of Kirk Yetholm,in the Cheviot Hills, adjoining to the English Border.

title: Guy Mannering; or, The Astrologer - Complete
author: Scott, Walter
snippet: The individual gipsy upon whom the character of Meg Merrilies was foundedwas well known about the middle of the last century by the name of JeanGordon, an inhabitant of the village of Kirk Yetholm, in the CheviotHills, adjoining to the English Border.

title: Guy Mannering /
author: Scott, Walter
